findings.title: Approve of Front running Attack
findings.description: The approve() method overrides current allowance regardless of whether the spender already used it or not, so there is no way to increase or decrease allowance by a certain value atomically unless the token owner is a smart contract, not an account. This can be abused by a token receiver when they try to withdraw certain tokens from the sender's account.

findings.title: Long Number Literals
findings.description: Using long number literals can lead to precision loss and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized modification of transaction tax
findings.description: The contract owner may contain the authority to modify the transaction tax. If the transaction tax is increased to more than 49%, the tokens may not be able to be traded.

findings.title: Potential zero fee or no max wallet size for addresses
Potential modification of maximum trading amount or maximum position
findings.description: If there is a function for this, the maximum trading amount or maximum position can be modified. Can cause honeypot.
findings.function: Max Transaction and Holding Modify Function

findings.title: Honeypot Risk
findings.description: If the transaction tax is increased to more than 49%, the tokens may not be able to be traded.
